pageContent: Introduction: Focal therapy has increasingly become an accepted treatment option for patients with localised prostate cancer. Most follow-up protocols use a mixture of protocol biopsies or "for cause" biopsies triggered by a rising PSA. In this paper, we discuss the histological outcomes from these biopsies and their use in guiding subsequent management and trial development.

metaData.source:
Impact of Focal Versus Whole Gland Ablation for Prostate Cancer on Sexual Function and Urinary Continence
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33119421/
